quiz.text: Which one of the following organisations has recently (September 2023) released the “Assessment Report on Invasive Alien Species and their Control”?
options: World Bank
Conservation International
Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change
Intergovernmental Platform on Biodiversity and Ecosystem Services
Global Growth Green Institute

quiz.text: According to the recently (September 2023) released “Assessment Report on Invasive Alien Species and their Control”, there is the presence of approximately ________ alien species, introduced by human activities, across various regions and biomes.
options: 37,000
38,000
39,000
40,000
41,000

quiz.text: As per the recently (September 2023) released “Assessment Report on Invasive Alien Species and their Control”, the global economic cost of invasive alien species exceeded ___________ annually in 2019
options: $422 billion
$423 billion
$424 billion
$425 billion
$426 billion

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (September 2023) released “Assessment Report on Invasive Alien Species and their Control”.1. The most common impact of alien invasive species is the reduction of the food supply2. Most negative impacts are reported on the Marine ecosystem3. World’s most widespread invasive alien species on land is Lantana (a flowering shrub)Which of the following statements is/are incorrect?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
Both 2 and 3
Both 1 and 2

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (September 2023) released “Assessment Report on Invasive Alien Species and their Control”.1. The annual costs of invasive alien species has at least quadrupled every decade since 19702. No countries have included targets related to managing invasive alien species in their national biodiversity plans3. Out of 37,000 alien species which are invasive 22% are alien invertebrates.Which of the following statements is/are correct?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Both 1 and 3
Both 2 and 3
None

quiz.text: As per the recently (September 2023) released “Assessment Report on Invasive Alien Species and their Control”, there are 5 major direct drivers of biodiversity loss globally, which of the following is not one of them?
options: Invasive alien species
land and sea-use change
Increase in human population
Direct exploitation of organisms
pollution

quiz.text: Which of the following entities has recently (September 2023), released “Swachh Vayu Sarvekshan 2023”?
options: Central Pollution Control Board
NITI Aayog
Environmentalist Foundation of India
Centre for Environment Education
Greenpeace India

quiz.text: Recently (September 2023), Swachh Vayu Sarvekshan 2023 was released, an initiative by the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEFCC) to rank cities on the basis of air quality, it assessed the cities on 8 major points, which one of the following is not one of them?
options: Municipal solid waste burning
Control of biomass
Improvement in PM 2.5 concentration
Road dust
Improvement in PM10 concentration

quiz.text: Recently (September 2023), Swachh Vayu Sarvekshan 2023 was released, an initiative by the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEFCC) to rank cities on the basis of air quality, which one of the following cities is not at the Top 5 in category 1st?
options: Agra
Thane
Indore
Agartala
Bhopal

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (September 2023), released “Swachh Vayu Sarvekshan 2023”, by the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEFCC).1. Indore secured first rank in the 1st Category.2. Amravati secured first rank in the 2nd Category.3. Kala Amb secured first rank in the 3rd Category.Which of the following is/are incorrect?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
Both 1 and 2
All of the above

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (September 2023), released “Swachh Vayu Sarvekshan 2023”, by the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEFCC).1. Category 1 considers the Cities having a population of more than 10 lakhs.2. Category 2 considers the Cities having a population between 3 lakhs and 10 lakhs.3. Category 3 considers the Cities having a Population Under 3 lakhs.Which of the following is/are incorrect?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following organizations has recently (September 2023), released the “2023 Trade Finance Gaps, Growth, and Jobs Survey”?
options: Asian Development Bank
World Bank
World Economic Forum
IMF
New Development Bank

quiz.text: According to the recently (September 2023), released “2023 Trade Finance Gaps, Growth, and Jobs Survey”, the global trade finance gap grew to a record __________ in 2022, from $1.7 trillion two years earlier, as rising interest rates, flagging economic prospects, inflation, and geopolitical volatility reduced the capacity of banks to deliver trade financing.
options: $2.6 trillion
$2.5 trillion
$2.4 trillion
$2.3 trillion
$2.2 trillion

quiz.text: According to the recently (September 2023), released “2023 Trade Finance Gaps, Growth, and Jobs Survey”, the difference between requests and approvals for financing to support imports and exports grew by _________ from $1.7 trillion in 2020.
options: 67%
57%
47%
37%
27%

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (September 2023), released “2023 Trade Finance Gaps, Growth, and Jobs Survey”.1. The Global Trade finance gap in 2022 was $2.5 trillion.2. Global goods exports grew by 26.6% in 2021.3. The top supply chain challenge according to firms was Insufficient financing.Which of the following is/are correct?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following organization has recently (September 2023), released the “Progress on the Sustainable Development Goals: The gender snapshot 2023” report?
options: International Alliance of Women
World Bank
World Economic Forum
UN Women
Women for Women International

quiz.text: According to the recently (September 2023), released “Progress on the Sustainable Development Goals: The gender snapshot 2023” report, if current trends of progress continue, over 340 million women and girls will still live in extreme poverty by __________.
options: 2030
2035
2025
2040
2045

quiz.text: According to the recently (September 2023), released “Progress on the Sustainable Development Goals: The gender Snapshot 2023” report, Girls have outperformed boys in school completion at all education levels, yet completion rates still fall short of 100%, while _________ of girls have completed upper secondary schooling, the figure for boys is ____________.
options: 20% & 17%
30% & 27%
40% & 37%
50% & 47%
60% & 57%

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (September 2023), released “Progress on the Sustainable Development Goals: The gender snapshot 2023”.1. An extra $360 billion annually is required to achieve gender equality and women empowerment.2. 60% of countries lack comprehensive gender equality laws, including equal marriage and divorce rights.3. All of Goal 5 indicators are at “target met or almost met”.Which of the following is/are correct?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
All of the above
None of the above

quiz.text: Consider the following statements regarding the recently (September 2023), released “Progress on the Sustainable Development Goals: The gender snapshot 2023”.1. Universal electricity access could lift 185 million women and girls out of poverty by 20502. In 2022, only 27% of international patent inventors were women, while men accounted for 73%3. Climate change-induced food insecurity is expected to affect an additional 236 million women and girls4. 30% of countries are on track to eliminate intimate partner violence.Which of the following is/are correct?
options: Only 1
Only 2
Both 1 and 3
Both 2 and 4
All of the above

quiz.text: According to recently (September 2023) released “Best Countries Rankings” by the U.S. News & World Report's, which of the following country has not made up to Top 5 positions in the list?
options: Switzerland
Canada
Sweden
Australia
Norway

quiz.text: According to the recently (September 2023) released 'Best Countries Rankings' by U.S. News & World Report,  Japan, Singapore, China, and South Korea are in the top 25, while India has secured ________ position in the ranking.
options: 29th
30th
31st
32nd
33rd
